title: Is Selena Gomez's new song Lose You To Love Me about Justin Bieber?
text:
Selena Gomez has seemingly thrown a little shade the way of one of her exes in her latest song, with fans believing it to be Justin Bieber.

Selena and Justin famously dated on and off from 2009 to 2017 before the singer went on to date The Weeknd.

They reunited briefly before calling it quits in March 2018. By July of the same year Justin was engaged to Hailey Baldwin, with the pair tying the knot in September (and for a second time last month).

In Selena’s latest tune, an emotional ballad Lose You To Love Me, she sings about being ‘replaced’ in two months ‘like it was easy’ while also shading this ex for ‘singing off-key’ in her chorus.

There is no mention of names, of course, but fans online are putting their armchair detective caps on and believe it to be Biebs. While others think it might be The Weeknd. And others just want to enjoy the tune.

Selena and Justin famously dated for years (Picture: Getty Images)

In one emotional verse, Selena, 27, sings: ‘I gave my all and they all know it / You turned me down, and now it’s showing / In two months you replaced us / Like it was easy / Made me think I deserved it.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

If you needed a walk down memory lane, it may be referring to the apparently quick turnaround of his split from Selena and reunion with Hailey – who he’d dated in the past during one of his breaks from Selena.

Keeping up?

In another verse, she sings: ‘Sang off-key in my chorus / ‘Cause it wasn’t yours / You promised the world / Made her more of a woman /I needed to lose you to find me.’

Ooofft, this both stings and makes our own hearts hurt at the same time.

If you’ll remember, Justin was a featured artist on her songs Can’t Steal Our Love back in 2013 as well as Unfamiliar the following year.

Fans thought they’d put two and two together as they took to social media and suggested it was all about Biebs.

she deserves so much more and this part killed me „in two months you replaced us” this is a goodbye song to Justin and I LOVE IT, it’s finally done #LoseYouToLoveMe pic.twitter.com/L9JVkryi3p — #LoseYouToLoveMe (@familiarhadid) October 23, 2019

Selena release a song about Justin. This song is about that bieber dude. Releasing same month when Justin got married. She’s closing her chapter with him. She’s finally moving on. Am I really following this rempit drama? U bet i am. — ctzainol (@ct_zainol) October 23, 2019

selena’s new song is 6000% about justin and even tho she bugs me ……. my heart is aching for her after listening to those lyrics :( — tay ❃ (@liltayann) October 23, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

However, another defended the tune as not being about the singer at all, as they wrote: ‘This dynamic, complex ballad explores the lows of her life that she’s made it through; lupus, rehab, abusive relationships and other private downfalls. she was very brave to make this.’

As to the real subject of the song, maybe we’ll never know.

While we have no idea really who she’s singing about, and it could all be a very convenient metaphor for no specific love, Selena has been open in having a chuckle about her previously-serious relationship with the now-married Justin.

Justin is now married to Hailey (Picture: @justinbieber)

In 2013 she made a barb when David Letterman revealed his own emotional run-in with Bieber, saying: ‘Now, the last time he was on, he and I got into a conversation and he said something and I said something, and then he said something and I said something, and I made him cry.’

Delivering her cutting response, the actress said: ‘Well then, that makes two of us.’

At the end of September, according to People Justin and Hailey said ‘I do’ in front of 154 guests during sunset at the five-star, 20,000 acre private resort Montage Palmetto Bluff, where rooms cost $314 (£255) a night.

They exchanged vows in a ceremony that was held on site at the Somerset Chapel in front of a star-studded guestlist, including the likes of Kendall Jenner, Katy Perry and Scooter Braun.

description: Selena Gomez sings about 'being replaced in 2 months' and of course everyone thinks it's about Justin Bieber.
